Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the "Naked" line of juices and smoothies contain the toxic preservative formaldehyde, which has not been proven.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the assertion that the products contain formaldehyde.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that because there was a lawsuit settlement regarding misleading labels, it automatically means the products contain formaldehyde, which is a problematic assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the lawsuit settlement was related to deceptive labeling and not the presence of formaldehyde in the products.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the lawsuit settlement was due to the use of unnatural and synthetic non-juice ingredients, as well as the use of concentrate, rather than the presence of formaldehyde.
